title.rendered: World Cancer Day observed in Mumbai

content.rendered:
The World Cancer day was observed on 4th February 2018. Continuing the observation a general awareness activity was conducted with the beneficiaries of Smile on Wheels in Mumbai. An OPD session was conducted for the people. The harmful effects of consuming different types of tobacco were discussed with the people and the measures for preventing the deadly disease were also discussed. A discussion on how to take care of thir general health was also discussed with the beneficiaries.

Smile on Wheels programme at present has 34 operational projects in 265 remote villages and urban slums across India, directly benefitting over 400,000 lives in a year.

Smile Foundation is an NGO in India directly benefitting over 600,000 children and their families every year, through more than 250 live welfare projects on education, healthcare, livelihood and women empowerment, in over 950 remote villages and slums across 25 states of India.
